items.title: CLI asks for username & password instead of token when using --profile
items.body:
I successfully setup the default profile using "databricks configure", the prompt asked me for the host, then a token. I could see the content of my workspace with "databricks workspace ls", everything is working fine.

Now if I try to setup another profile (say, a production profile) using "databricks configure --profile prod", now after entering my host, the prompt asks for an username and password instead of a token.

I entered bogus information, then I changed the content of C:\Users\myself\.databrickscfg to correct my `prod` configuration and follow the `DEFAULT` one (with a different host and token), and now everything works fine.

How come the prompt did not ask for a token?

Plus the password is stored in plain text...

items.title: Add support for the Token REST api
items.body:
It would be good to have a Python wrapper around the REST API https://docs.databricks.com/dev-tools/api/latest/tokens.html

This would help us automate Token creation / destruction & monitoring

items.title: Add support for SCIM API
items.body:
For our use case at Edmunds, we need to support IAM Passthrough via meta-instance-profiles, there are some operational steps that need to be executed. Namely the mapping, in Databricks, between users/groups to IAM roles.

Is it possible for us to add a SCIM API module using the official documentation? https://docs.databricks.com/dev-tools/api/latest/scim.html 

This is a high priority task for us and we would like to start contributing from our end if possible.

items.title: Support passing of databricks token as an argument to CLI command.
items.body: The use case which we have in mind is , we want to run databricks cli from a CI server like jenkins and want to pass the databricks token from the credentials store to the jenkins pipeline stage at run time .

2. Generated Token in Azure Databricks

4. Databricks Host : https://westeurope.azuredatabricks.net
5. Token:xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
6. databricks secrets create-scope --scope my-scope
Above mentioned Error

Also my question i am using Databricks in Azure not directly by logging into Databricks.com is that the reason of this error? because when for example i try : databricks workspace ls /Users/example@databricks.com , Instead of example i write my email address which is my user name and then should it stay databricks.com or should i change it to @westeurope.azuredatabricks.net. 

Thanks in Advance

items.title: databricks workspace list broken due to new options
items.body:
```$ databricks workspace ls --debug
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/databricks_cli/utils.py", line 42, in decorator
    return function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/databricks_cli/configure/config.py", line 55, in decorator
    return function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/databricks_cli/workspace/cli.py", line 55, in ls_cli
    objects = WorkspaceApi(api_client).list_objects(workspace_path)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/databricks_cli/workspace/api.py", line 94, in list_objects
    return [WorkspaceFileInfo.from_json(f) for f in objects]
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/databricks_cli/workspace/api.py", line 94, in <listcomp>
    return [WorkspaceFileInfo.from_json(f) for f in objects]
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/databricks_cli/workspace/api.py", line 76, in from_json
    return cls(**deserialized_json)
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'created_at'
```
It's broken now because the workspace API now returns more fields like created_at.

items.title: dbfs ls doesn't have enough options - like the timestamp
items.body:
➜  ~ `dbfs ls -h`
Usage: dbfs ls [OPTIONS] [DBFS_PATH]...

  List files in DBFS.

Options:
  --absolute      Displays absolute paths.
  -l              Displays full information including size and file type.
  --debug         Debug Mode. Shows full stack trace on error.
  --profile TEXT  CLI connection profile to use. The default profile is
                  "DEFAULT".
  -h, --help      Show this message and exit.

**-l** is the only additional option which gives the size and file type

but there is no option to know the **time** at which the file was created/updated

would be good to have a flag like **-t**
`dbfs ls -t` which will give the timestamp details of the files

items.title: Uninstall all libraries fails if cluster does not contain libraries
items.body:
Databricks CLI uninstall all libraries fails if no libraries installed on cluster.
Sample cluster status:
**Command**: 
``` 
databricks libraries list --cluster-id <cluster_id> 
```
**Response**: 
``` 
{ 
    "cluster_id": "<cluster_id>" 
} 
```

Using the CLI command `uninstall` on a cluster which has no libraries installed returns an error.

**Command**: 
``` 
databricks libraries uninstall --all --cluster-id <cluster_id> 
```
**Response**: 
``` 
Error: b'{"error_code":"INTERNAL_ERROR","message":"Unexpected error"}' 
```

Ideally the CLI should succeed when uninstalling all libraries even if none are present.
At minimum it should return a descriptive message.

items.title: Add CLI and API capability for clearing files and folders in a workspace
Missing option to permanently delete a cluster
items.body:
There seems to be no option to use the cli to call this REST endpoint  

2.0/clusters/permanent-delete

https://docs.azuredatabricks.net/api/latest/clusters.html#permanent-delete

items.title: Issue with 'Six' package during installation
items.body:
Cannot uninstall 'six'. It is a distutils installed project and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong to it which would lead to only a partial uninstall.

It's unable to to install due to the above issue.

items.title: Bad error message when credentials are invalid
items.body:
Used databricks cli to import workspace with bad credentials (invalid Token).
Received the following error message:

```
$ databricks workspace import_dir -o dummy/ /Shared/dummy
Error: ValueError: No JSON object could be decoded
```

items.title: Jobs api gives an error when there are no jobs
items.body:
# What happens:

## CLI
```
$ databricks  jobs list
Error: KeyError: 'jobs'
```
## SDK
```
>>> jobs_api.list_jobs()
{}
```

# What is expected
## CLI
```
$ databricks  jobs list

```
## SDK
```
>>> jobs_api.list_jobs()
{'jobs': []}
```

items.title: Implement cluster edit
items.body: The current clusters CLI does not support the edit API

items.title: Specify config file location
items.body: Point cli to use a different config file such as ~/.databricks/.databrickscfg both from a cli flag and from an environment variable

items.title: Add support for databricks-cli for development shards.
items.body: We should add a conf flag which optionally toggles the SSL cert verification off.

items.title: Add global --debug flag
items.body: It'd be useful to add a global flag called `--debug` which prints out the stack trace when an error is raised.

items.title: Error when running on Python 3.6
items.body:
I tried `pip install databricks-cli` (v 0.6.0) on Python 3.6.4 and when I try any command (say `databricks clusters list`). I get the following error
`Error: TypeError: a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'`

Does the cli support Python 3.6?

items.title: Error: AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2'
items.body: installed databricks-cli with pip3. Double checked I have latest version of open-ssl and upgraded python. Still getting the same message.

items.title: databricks clusters spark-versions does not work in Python3 with basic auth.
SSLError when running any command
items.body:
I just started having this problem a few days ago. I'm pretty sure I haven't installed any OSX updates that would have interfered. 

I tried re-installing my entire python/brew environment and it's the same. I'm able to hit API endpoints in the browser just fine so maybe there's something broken in the certificate chain in the python code?

Here's some sample output:

    Error: SSLError: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='<mycluster>.cloud.databricks.com', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /api/2.0/jobs/list (Caused by SSLError(SSLError("bad handshake: Error([('SSL routines', 'tls_process_server_certificate', 'certificate verify failed')],)",),))

Using Python 2.7.13 and databricks-cli (0.5.0).

As suggested on some other python projects for similar errors I tried installing `requests[security]`, but it did not help.

items.title: Should support `--profile` in different positions
items.body:
Users expect all of the following work:

* `databricks --profile XXX fs ls`
* `databricks fs --profile XXX ls`
* `databricks fs ls --profile XXX`

However, only the last one works with the current implementation.

items.title: Convert from Windows to Unix-style directory separators when importing and exporting
items.body: On Windows machines when running import_dir the directory separator is `\` which causes files vs folders to get created in the workspaces. Likewise, when exporting all the `/` in the workspace paths should be normalized to the local OS separator

items.title: Ignore hidden files and directories when importing
items.body: If a directory contains hidden files, a `.git` folder for instance, they seem to get imported when running `import_dir`. Should we be ignoring these by default?

items.title: databricks configure - multiple deployments/hosts
items.body:
Hi,

Is it possible to have multiple credential 'profiles' for different databricks deployments?  We have a dev, test and prod account (i.e 3 different hostnames) - each env is a seperate DBricks subscriptions.

Is it possible to have these seperate profiles configured  and used in a similar way to the aws cli --profile?

Thanks

items.title: databricks workspace export has misleading stdout information
items.body:
```
$ databricks workspace export_dir /Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example ./example                                                                                                             [11:46:10]
/Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example/Usage Logs ETL already exists locally as ./example/Usage Logs ETL.scala. Skip.
/Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example/Usage Logs ETL -> ./example/Usage Logs ETL.scala
/Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example/Databricks CLI Usage Analysis already exists locally as ./example/Databricks CLI Usage Analysis.py. Skip.
/Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example/Databricks CLI Usage Analysis -> ./example/Databricks CLI Usage Analysis.py
/Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example/Adhoc SQL already exists locally as ./example/Adhoc SQL.sql. Skip.
/Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example/Adhoc SQL -> ./example/Adhoc SQL.sql
/Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example/Plotting Notebook already exists locally as ./example/Plotting Notebook.r. Skip.
/Users/andrewchen@databricks.com/example/Plotting Notebook -> ./example/Plotting Notebook.r
```
We should only print the Skip line.

items.title: Changing on filenames in importing
items.body: When I import my workspace from databricks, somes files have its name altered. Usually the last letter is missing.

items.title: Import_dir importing hidden folders and files
items.body:
When I use import_dir to import many local files and folders if I have some hidden folder the API importing this folder as well. It is happening with ".git" hidden folder, for example. 
Does it working as expected? Is there a way to avoid import hidden folders and files?

items.title: The cp command does not return an error code when the target resource already exists
items.body:
When copying a file to dbfs without `--overwrite` and the resource already exists on dbfs, no file is copied and no exception is raised.
This behaviour leads to expecting the cp was successful even when the cp action is not performed.

items.title: databricks workspace --help is truncated
items.body:
```
$ databricks workspace --help                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        [14:21:57]
Usage: databricks workspace [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

  Utility to interact with the Databricks Workspace. Workspace paths must be
  absolute and be prefixed with `/`.

Options:
  -v, --version
  -h, --help     Show this message and exit.

Commands:
  delete      Deletes objects from the Databricks...
  export      Exports a file from the Databricks workspace...
  export_dir  Recursively exports a directory from the...
  import      Imports a file from local to the Databricks...
  import_dir  Recursively imports a directory from local to...
  list        List objects in the Databricks Workspace
  ls          List objects in the Databricks Workspace
  mkdirs      Make directories in the Databricks Workspace.
  rm          Deletes objects from the Databricks...```

We should use https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/486

items.title: Add support for the Workspace API.
items.body: https://docs.databricks.com/api/latest/workspace.html to enable CI/CD with Databricks.

items.title: Add support for authentication with token service.
items.body: In future releases of Databricks, we will have the ability to authenticate via a token. We should support using this in the databricks-cli.
